A Kind and Honourable Man

A dim tavern, filled with laughter.  
Katerina Ivanovna scowls, addressing Amalia.  
Katerina: “Not like your draggletails, Amalia!”  

---

A drunken clerk, slurring his words.  
Clerk: “Yes, he loved drink! So fond of it!”  

---

Katerina, frustrated, defends her late husband.  
Katerina: “He was kind! Loved his family!”  

---

Katerina sighs, lost in memories.  
Clerk: “A cock? Did you say a cock?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna defends her late husband’s character, emphasizing his kindness and love for his family despite his drinking problem.
